doc.field: - The Federal National Mortgage Association said it will begin purchasing 10 and 20-year fixed rate mortgages in addition to 15 and 30 year mortgages. It said the new intermediate term mortgage purchase programs are designed to offer home buyers more home financing flexibility. Edward J. Pinto, FNMA's Senior Vice President, said intermediate term mortgages offer "lower interest rates, substantial interest savings, lower inflation rates and, in many cases, faster equity build-up" than longer-term mortgages.
